Articles.Content:
It's finally HERE!

Yeah! A lot of new things have been added. Wouldn't want to spoil it for ya, though.

0.9.7.2 is absolutely incredible, but also filled with Windows crashing bugs. (leading to BSOD's)

When playing it, do not :

Activate hyperdrive.

Get anywhere near a black hole.

Activate Fisheye view.

If you do this, Windows crashes.

Other than that, the graphics are even better as well as the interface
How do I toggle the UI so I don't have to see it? I simply cannot find this feature.

Unless there's been some update today, I'm pretty sure this version has been around for a little while now. I just checked the last copy I downloaded (8th January) and it's definitely 0.9.7.2.

You had me all excited there. Oh well. I'm here now, I may as well post some screenshots

A blue ice giant and one of its moons, both with rings.

One of the galaxies I stumbled across while having an intergalactic exploration session.

A very colourful nebula in some far flung spiral.

You know the descriptor for Duna in KSP? How the strong red starkly contrasts the colour green? Yeah, well...

The green planet/moon looks pretty cool.

A binary galaxy system. These two are very close together, and there's another galaxy not far away with a great view of the whole shebang.

The planet I spawned around (in the background) and one of its two cold desert moons (foreground). This was a long way from the Milky Way, let me tell you.

It was so close to being a view of Jool from Laythe. Unfortunately, there were no oceans on this moon of that very green gas giant.

Can we haz accretion disks pls? Seriously, since seeing the black hole in Interstellar, I want every black hole ever to have an accretion disk just so the gravitational lensing can do its job.

I guess twisting the galaxy into funky shapes will do for now

The surface of a cold desert planet that is currently holding some particular fascination with me because of its striking beauty.

All around that same cold desert. I named the ship the IEV Dawn Rising. I also decided to put a fuel ship around a moon not far from here. Dunno why, just thought I would.

Said fuel ship around said moon. Looks a little bit like Tylo, now that I think of it.

Why yes, it is here (and as mentioned it has been for a little while now). Alas, the new version is abnormally buggy for me and nothing looks quite right any more. Le sigh... I hope Space Engineer plans to do a stability/compatibility-focused update soon.
